topic.title: Events Query Command

body.p: The Events Query MRPC command is used to query all the events that have occurred in Switchtec. There is no input parameter format for this MRPC command, just issue the command id(0x28) to MRPC command offset: 0x800, all the events bitmap in Switchtec will be returned to the output area(0x400). The output data will contain: global events bitmap, partition events bitmap, and the port events bitmap.

topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d)
topic.title: EVENTS QUERY â€” Output Format

section.p: This section will define the output format for the Events Query MRPC command.

table.title: Event Query MRPC Command Output Data

body.p: A bit set means there is event in corresponding event slot.
A bit set means that there is partition event or port event in that partition

Indicate the number of partitions which events occurred. This number should match the value in the Partition Event Bitmap Register. For each partition with events there is a 3-DW descriptor consisting of Partition Event Summary Register (1DW) and a Logical Port Event Bitmap Register(2DW). If the Partition Count is zero, there will be no data following.
When a partition event happens, the corresponding bit is set.
Bit 3 - Dynamic Partitioning Binding Command Finish, (RO)
When a logical port in this partition has a port event, the corresponding bit is set, (RO)

For partitions with events, there will be a 3-DW descriptor. The order of the 3-DW events description is just as the non-zero bit order (LSB first) in the Partition Event Bitmap Register. The number of the 3-DW events description is indicated in the Partition Count.

Indicates the number of ports which reported events. If the Port Count value is N, then it means that there are following N*2DW description. Each 2-DW description contains the Ports Mapping Info(1DW) + Port Event Summary Register(1DW).
Describes the binding information for a physical port , logical port in a partition, and the function instance.
Events are indicated with a 1b set in the corresponding event slot., (RO)
body.note: We reserve all config space after this register for port events. This region is only applicable to P2P bridge functions that are bound to a physical port (not shadow P2Ps) and NT EndPoint with USP Mode = 0x3: NT EP Only.
